content: Anyone else experience an issue with importing content from D7 using Feeds where unpublished nodes aren't imported at all...?
I have a Published Status column in the CSV file, and am mapping that to Backdrop's Published field, but unpublished nodes just aren't importing. Will try investigating.
Are the unpublished nodes being exported?
@oadaeh (Jason Flatt) Yep, can see them in the CSV file.
Ah! Figured it out! I was seeing unpublished nodes in the CSV as I was logged in. When I downloaded the CSV as an anonymous user then there were no unpublished nodes in it.
Now to work out how to get unpublished nodes to export without making them accessible to everyone on the site in general...

I guess easiest way is to change my Feeds import in Backdrop from URL (which means the Drupal URL has to be accessible to anonymous users) to file upload (then I just download the file as an admin, and import that into Backdrop).

Proudly presenting... my first XML import from the Censhare publishing system (I used to work for them for some months, long time ago). The site will be a church website, getting the local events out of the national event calendar. The greatest thing is: it works with OOTB with Feeds and Feeds XPath Parse... thank you @Alexandr for porting the module. Screenshot-2021-02-03-at-16.12.04.png

A question to all the Feeds experts here: I'd like to import names from a CSV file to a Multifield consisting of the subfields "First name" and "Last name". At first sight, the node importer doesn't allow at all to select a multifield as a target. What can I do to import to a multifield? Do I need an additional module like Feeds Tamper or XPath Parser, or are there other approaches?
Tamper helps with dividing and cleaning up the source but for the target you might need something more. Is there a feeds file in multifield module?
Maybe https://www.drupal.org/project/multifield/issues/2414049 ?
@Laryn that patch seems like it would work. Multifield maintainer will need to add this
...for Backdrop
@Laryn Thanks for pointing to the Drupal issue! Had also found it but was wondering if it was already fixed in Backdrop (and I missing something else).

Multifield maintainer? :sweat: (I think I'm still technically a co-maintainer there (@jenlampton is the other) but am not actively using the module at the moment so probably won't have time to work on this one -- but since there's already a patch perhaps it can be converted to a PR for Backdrop by...someone? @Olaf Grabienski? :smile:
Oh!

Was just going to add this as an issue and found this: https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/multifield/issues/39

Feeds importer support · Issue #39 · backdrop-contrib/multifield
I need to import a bunch of data from CSV spreadsheets, and would like my multifields to be populated from the sheet. I've got imports running with this change but would love help testing!
@jenlampton Is ahead of us. "I've got imports running with this change but would love help testing!"
@jenlampton ++
jenlampton leveled up! (Karma: 17)

Was just going to add this as an issue and found this: https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/multifield/issues/39

Great, will test it soon!

Tested @jenlampton's Multifield PR, it works, thank you very much! https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/multifield/issues/39#issuecomment-782007079

Feeds importer support · Issue #39 · backdrop-contrib/multifield
I need to import a bunch of data from CSV spreadsheets, and would like my multifields to be populated from the sheet. I've got imports running with this change but would love help testing!
